data.title: More Heat Records Across Saskatchewan
data.meta_description: As the province remains blanketed in heat warnings, Saskatoon and Lucky Lake Saskatchewan get the honours yesterday (Fri) for having the highest tempe...
data.text:
As the province remains blanketed in heat warnings, Saskatoon and Lucky Lake Saskatchewan get the honours yesterday (Fri) for having the highest temperatures in the province. Both communities saw the mercury rise to 40 degrees Celsius. In Saskatoon overnight temperature also remained above 20 degrees. Those two locations were also the hotspots in Canada on Friday. While day time highs for Friday haven’t been issued by Environment Canada as yet, Meterologist Janelle Gergley says there were 35 records broken across the province on Friday.

Both Saskatoon and Prince Albert hit their daily records. Saskatoon at exactly 40 degrees, and Prince Albert hit 36.2 degrees. Saskatoon’s previous record for July 2nd was 33.4 degrees. The highest temperature ever recorded in Saskatoon was 41.5 degrees back in 1988.

35 daily maximum temperature records were broken yesterday, Friday July 2 as a prolonged heat wave continues to impact the province. The following areas set a daily maximum temperature record on July 2, 2021: Broadview Area New record of 33.0 Old record of 32.8 set in 1949 Records in this area have been kept since 1938 Buffalo Narrows Area New record of 35.8 Old record of 31.7 set in 2013 Records in this area have been kept since 1962 Collins Bay Area New record of 34.9 Old record of 32.1 set in 2013 Records in this area have been kept since 1972 Coronach Area New record of 35.6 Old record of 35.0 set in 1985 Records in this area have been kept since 1961 Cypress Hills (Provincial Park) Area New record of 33.9 Old
